definition: incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
gauze/to collect/to gather/to catch/to sift
surname Luo
suck

sentences.english: This poem is well written and very concise.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗写得十分精到，一点也不罗嗦。

sentences.english: In sum, this "Lei Fong" is sensitive to the extent that he is pedantic and wordy.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，这“雷锋”已经细致到有点迂腐和罗嗦了。

sentences.english: Your boss is so verbose, his speech should be concise and comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 你们老板也太罗嗦了，应该言简意赅一点。

sentences.english: Prolixity is a method to practice oral English, too.
sentences.chinese: 罗嗦也是一种练习英语口语的方法。

sentences.english: For example, you could describe someone as"Tautologically loquacious".
sentences.chinese: 例如，你可以描述一个人‘同义反复地罗嗦’。

sentences.english: When they are naggingly repeating some age-old stories.
sentences.chinese: 当他们罗罗嗦唆重复一些老掉牙的故事。

sentences.english: As we know prolixity is a big shortcoming to write articles.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，罗嗦是写文章的大忌。

definition: variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
long-winded/wordy/troublesome/pesky/also pr. [luo1 suo1]
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
to talk at length/to waste one's breath/variant of 廢話|废话[fei4 hua4]
effeminate/old-womanish/garrulous/fainthearted/overly careful/overly sensitive/maudlin
to chatter/to babble
impatience/impatient
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to prattle/to chatter away/to nag/garrulous/nagging
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
patient (not impatient)
polite/courteous/formal/modest
